pullRequest.body:
Included a lemma that asserts that two vector submodules of a vector space in a `RClike field' are equal if and only if their orthogonal complements are equal 

---

https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ orthogonalComplement_eq_orthogonalComplement`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>
@Samyak-DT make sure when you are finished addressing comments on PRs that you remove the `awaiting-author` label in order to guarantee the PR will get reviewed again.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9981350801/job/27584800335)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9981350801/job/27584800550)
Thanks for this! It does indeed appear to be missing, as you can verify with [Loogle](https://loogle.lean-lang.org/?q=%3FKᗮ+%3D+%3FLᗮ)

I would reverse the order (which forces a rename), and then it can be a `simp` lemma. It can't be a `simp` lemma without reverse the order because then it would just keep adding `ᗮ` repeatedly.
```suggestion
@[simp]
theorem orthogonalComplement_eq_orthogonalComplement {L : Submodule 𝕜 E} [HasOrthogonalProjection K]
    [HasOrthogonalProjection L] : Kᗮ = Lᗮ ↔ K = L := by
```

With the above suggested change, you can do this for the proof (otherwise you have to reverse the order of the arguments):
```
  ⟨fun h ↦ by simpa using congr(Submodule.orthogonal $(h)),
    fun h ↦ congr(Submodule.orthogonal $(h))⟩
```
A few notes about this proof:
1. `congr()` is a *really* cool way of building equalities from existing ones. `congrArg` (or `congr_arg`) is the way of doing it by hand, but after you try to prove `a + b = c + d` from `h₁ : a = c` and `h₂ : b = d` using `congr_arg` alone (not allowing yourself `rw`), you will realize the full power of `congr`, which can do this simply as `congr($(h₁) + $(h₂))`.
2. `simpa using <term>` is nice because it allows you to supply a term which only needs to agree with the goal up to simplification. So if Lean can simplify this term and the goal to the same thing, it closes the goal.
3. While I see what you were doing with the backwards rewriting, it can sort of be a sign (not always) that you're doing something in a non-optimal way if you are reverse-rewriting `simp` lemmas. At the very least, if you try to `simp` after you undo your work. So, instead, it can sometimes be helpful to build a *more* complicated term, and then simplify it, which is what I've done here. In the first line, `h : Kᗮ = Lᗮ`, then the `congr(Submodule.orthogonal $(h)) : Kᗮᗮ = Lᗮᗮ`, and the `simpa` uses `Submodule.orthogonal_orthogonal` under the hood to remove the doubled perps to yield `K = L`, as desired.

This last one is a pretty common trick, and I think it's closer to what you might do on paper.
Thank you for the helpful comments!

`by exact` (almost) never does anything useful.
```suggestion
    [HasOrthogonalProjection L] : Kᗮ = Lᗮ ↔ K = L :=
  ⟨fun h ↦ by simpa using congr(Submodule.orthogonal $(h)),
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add `orthogonalComplement_eq_orthogonalComplement`
